description: Accounting is the language of business. It is a system of recording, analyzing and summarizing financial activities. The University of Findlay's Accounting Program prepares students for careers in public, private and governmental accounting. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for the Certified Public Accountant (CPA) exam, Certified Management Accountant (CMA) exam and the Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) exam.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

Concentration name: Integrated Language Arts, Integrated Mathematics, Integrated Science, Integrated Social Studies, Life Science, Physical Science (Chemistry), Physical Science (Physics)
description: The University of Findlay’s adolescent/young adult licensure program prepares students to teach in grades 7-12. You will be prepared to teach in middle and high school settings. In addition to your education coursework, you will take classes in the content area you choose to teach.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: The University of Findlay’s Adolescent/Young Adult Integrated English/Language Arts program leads to an Ohio Resident Educator License valid for teaching learners in grades 7-12. The program prepares candidates to be knowledgeable, competent, and caring teachers who are ready to make a positive impact in the classroom.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: University of Findlay’s Adolescent/Young Adult Integrated Mathematics Program prepares you for a career in teaching mathematics to students in grades 7-12. You will learn how to verify mathematical facts, solve problems, and use mathematical models to represent real-world phenomena. In addition, you will learn how to use technology to teach mathematics and how to assess student learning.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: Adolescent/young adult licensure prepares you to teach students in grades 7-12. If you want to help these students navigate their way through high school while teaching a subject you love, this is the program for you!
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: Adolescent/young adult - integrated mathematics is a four-year program that prepares students for licensure in mathematics for grades 7-12. You will take a combination of education and mathematics courses. The education courses will cover instructional styles, theories of learning and assessment. The mathematics courses will cover calculus, probability, statistics and geometry. Field experience is a major component of the program. You will continuously be in the field observing and teaching in a classroom throughout your four years.
Accreditation status: The College of Education programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

Concentration name: Life Science, Physical Science: Chemistry, Physical Science: Physics, Earth Science
description:
Adolescent/Young Adult (AYA) Science candidates are prepared to teach students in grades 7-12. Candidates are prepared for licensure in one of the following areas: Life Science, Physical Science: Chemistry, Physical Science: Physics, Earth Science. 

If you enjoy science and working with teenagers, a career in science education may be the right fit for you. As a science teacher, you'll combine your passion for science and desire to help students learn. Science teachers are in high demand nationwide, and Findlay's education program will prepare you for the classroom.

The Adolescent/Young Adult Integrated Social Studies Program at the University of Findlay prepares students for a career in teaching social studies to adolescents and young adults in grades 7-12. Students will learn how to plan and implement lessons, assess student learning, and manage a classroom. They will also gain a deep understanding of the social studies content they will be teaching, including history, geography, government, and economics.
Accreditation status: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

description: The certificate in All Hazards Emergency Management prepares students to lead and manage in crisis situations. The curriculum is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the phases of emergency management: mitigation, preparedness, response, and recovery.

The industry option is a combination of business and animal science. This option is designed for students who are interested in the business side of the animal industry. Students in this option will take courses in animal science as well as courses in accounting, marketing, management, and economics.

This option is designed for students who wish to attend veterinary school. The curriculum is rigorous and includes chemistry, biology, physics and mathematics, as well as the animal science courses. Students will have the opportunity to work with a variety of animals, including beef and dairy cattle, sheep, goats, swine and horses.
The science option is designed for students interested in graduate school or careers in research, nutrition, reproduction or genetics. Strong emphasis is placed on chemistry, biology and physics.

The science option prepares students to work with animals in a variety of capacities. This option is for students interested in the scientific aspects of animal management including breeding and genetics, nutrition, physiology, growth, behavior and management systems. This option is also excellent preparation for graduate school.

Concentration name: Digital Media Design, Graphic Design, Photography, Printmaking, Painting, Drawing, Ceramics
description: As an art major, you’ll gain a broad-based education in the visual arts with the flexibility to focus on a specific discipline. You will develop your technical and conceptual skills while building a professional portfolio. This degree offers a mix of hands-on studio courses, art history, and general education requirements.

The Art Management major is designed for the student who loves art and has an aptitude for business. This degree combines art courses with business and communication courses to prepare students for entry-level positions in museums, galleries, non-profit arts organizations and auction houses.

As a visual arts education major, you will be prepared to teach art to students in grades pre-K through 12. You will complete the requirements for a Bachelor of Arts in Visual Arts as well as the professional education coursework required for the Multi-Age Visual Arts License.
Accreditation status: The University of Findlay’s Art Program is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

description: The biochemistry major prepares students for graduate study in biochemistry and related fields; professional school (medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, or veterinary medicine); or entry-level positions in clinical, industrial, or government laboratories.

Religious studies is an academic discipline that looks at religious beliefs, behaviors and institutions. It describes, compares, interprets and explains religion, emphasizing systematic, historically based, and cross-cultural perspectives. Students in the religious studies program at the University of Findlay are prepared for a variety of careers including: Social work, Non-profit sector, Journalism, Law, Ministry, Graduate school.

In the TESOL and Bilingual Education program, you will explore the relationship between language and culture and its impact on learning. You also will have the chance to create and execute lessons in the field. This program prepares you to teach English learners in a variety of contexts.
Accreditation status: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

description: Findlay’s biology program is designed to provide students with the flexibility to obtain a broad-based education in the biological sciences. Students in the biology program can choose between two options: General Biology or Pre-Veterinary Medicine Option.

With a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from the University of Findlay, you'll gain the critical skills and hands-on experience needed to lead in today's dynamic business environment. You will learn to analyze complex business problems, make data-driven decisions, and communicate effectively across all levels of an organization.
Accreditation status: The College of Business is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).

description: Accounting is the language of business. It communicates the financial condition and performance of a business to interested users for decision-making purposes. As an accounting major, you will learn how to analyze and interpret financial data to make informed business decisions. The University of Findlay's accounting program is designed to prepare you for a successful career in the public, private, or governmental sectors. Students in the accounting program can obtain the 150 credit hours required to sit for the CPA exam in four years.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: Financial managers are responsible for the financial health of an organization. They produce financial reports, direct investment activities, and develop strategies and plans for the long-term financial goals of their organization. The University of Findlay’s finance emphasis prepares you to work in a variety of fields including corporate finance, banking, insurance, real estate and financial planning.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The Business Administration major allows students to tailor their degree to their career goals by choosing from one of five emphases. The Management Emphasis prepares students for leadership roles in a variety of organizations. Students develop skills in planning, organizing, leading, and controlling resources to achieve organizational goals.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The business administration major offers a practical, comprehensive curriculum designed to meet the diverse needs of students and the business community. Students are prepared for a wide range of career opportunities in business, government and non-profit organizations. The program integrates business theory with Christian values and ethics, preparing students for leadership roles in a changing global environment.

Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The multi-billion dollar sports industry needs business-savvy professionals. With a Business Administration degree with a Sport Business Strategy Emphasis, you will be prepared to enter this competitive field. You will learn the business side of sports including marketing, finance, sales, and management.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)
Program name: Business Administration - Sport Business Strategy Emphasis

description: As the world moves toward a greener future, businesses are looking for employees who understand the importance of sustainability. The business and sustainability practices minor at the University of Findlay is designed to give students a competitive edge in the job market by combining business acumen with environmental stewardship. This minor creates a unique opportunity for students to learn how to help organizations reduce their carbon footprint, eliminate waste, and become more energy-efficient while maintaining profitability.

Economics is the social science that studies how individuals, governments, firms and nations make choices on allocating scarce resources to satisfy their unlimited wants. It can generally be broken down into: Macroeconomics, which concentrates on the behavior of the aggregate economy; and Microeconomics, which focuses on individual consumers. As an economics student at the University of Findlay, you will learn to think critically about how incentives affect human behavior.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: This option is designed for the student who is interested in the management of information security. It combines computer science and business coursework to prepare students for careers as security analysts, security managers, or security auditors.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET

description: The Business Management Degree Completion Program is designed for students who have completed an associate degree or have earned approximately 60 or more transferable credit hours. This program allows you to complete your bachelor's degree in as little as two years. Classes are offered fully online in eight-week blocks to accommodate working professionals. You will learn the skills needed to effectively manage people, projects, and organizations. Coursework focuses on areas such as accounting, finance, marketing, organizational behavior, and strategic management.
Accreditation status: The Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP) Baccalaureate/Graduate Degree Board of Commissioners has awarded the University of Findlay College of Business accreditation of its business programs.

description: Business management focuses on the behavior of people in organizations and the best ways to lead and manage them. As a business management major, you will learn how to plan, organize, lead and control resources to achieve organizational goals. You will also learn how to manage change and innovation in a dynamic global environment.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: Chemistry explains how the world around us works. From the medication we take, to the food we eat, to the clothes we wear, chemistry is involved in it all. Chemistry is the study of matter, its properties, how and why substances combine or separate to form other substances, and how substances interact with energy. The University of Findlay's Chemistry Program offers a Bachelor of Science degree that is approved by the American Chemical Society (ACS). The program provides students with a strong foundation in the five main areas of chemistry: organic, physical, analytical, inorganic and biochemistry.
Accreditation status: Approved by the American Chemical Society (ACS)

description: The University of Findlay's Children's Book Illustration Program is designed to help students find employment in the field of children's publishing. Students learn to create pictures that communicate a narrative and are appropriate for a specific age group. They also learn how to write and illustrate their own stories. The program is built on a strong foundation of drawing and design.
Accreditation status: The University of Findlay art programs are accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

description: The coaching minor is an excellent addition for students pursuing a career in education or for those who just love sports and want to stay involved. Students will learn the fundamentals of coaching, including: Philosophy and ethics; Safety and injury prevention; Physical conditioning; Growth and development; Teaching and communication; Sport skills and tactics; Organization and administration; Evaluation.

Concentration name: Digital Media, Organizational Communication, Strategic Communication
description: Communication is key to everything we do. It is the foundation of our relationships, our careers, and our society. As a student in the Communication Program, you will learn to communicate effectively across a variety of platforms and distinct contexts. You will learn to write, speak, and think critically, and you will develop the skills necessary to succeed in a rapidly changing world.

The University of Findlay's Mathematics program is designed to prepare students for careers in industry, government, education, or for graduate study. Students may choose from two emphases: Applied Mathematics for Data Analytics or Pure Mathematics. Mathematics is the universal language of the sciences. It is the foundation for all the natural sciences and is becoming increasingly important in the biological, social, and managerial sciences.

Computer science is the study of the theoretical foundations of information and computation and of practical techniques for their implementation and application in computer systems. This field has a profound impact on how we work and play. The Computer Science Program at the University of Findlay prepares students to become confident and capable problem solvers, to understand the fundamental theory and practice of computer science, and to understand the moral and ethical values associated with the computing discipline.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org, under the General Criteria and the Computer Science Program Criteria.

description: If you have an interest in corporate management, marketing, and finance, the business emphasis is for you. You will take core computer science courses, as well as accounting, finance, management, and marketing courses. Computer science is the study of the theoretical foundations of information and computation and their implementation and application in computer systems. It involves the study of algorithms, data structures, computer architecture, software design, and artificial intelligence.
Accreditation status: The Computer Science Program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

description: The University of Findlay's Computer Science Program prepares students to be software developers, database administrators, network administrators and more. Students will learn a variety of programming languages including C++, Java, Visual Basic, and Dot Net. Students also will learn how to communicate effectively, work in teams and manage projects.

Computer science is the study of the theoretical foundations of information and computation and of practical techniques for their implementation and application in computer systems. Computer scientists invent algorithmic processes that create, describe and transform information and formulate suitable abstractions to model complex systems. 

Data Analytics Emphasis: Focuses on the science of analyzing raw data to make conclusions about that information. Many of the techniques and processes of data analytics have been automated into mechanical processes and algorithms that work over raw data for human consumption.
Accreditation status: The Computer Science program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET

description: Information Assurance is a set of measures intended to protect and defend information and information systems by ensuring their availability, integrity, authentication, confidentiality, and non-repudiation. This includes providing for restoration of information systems by incorporating protection, detection, and reaction capabilities.
Accreditation status: The Computer Science Program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

description: Computer Science is the study of the design, development and analysis of software and hardware used to solve problems in a variety of business, scientific and social contexts. The Mathematics Emphasis is designed for students who are interested in the theoretical aspects of computer science or who plan to pursue graduate studies. This option provides a strong foundation in both computer science and mathematics, enabling students to tackle complex computational problems.
Accreditation status: The Computer Science Program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

description: Computer science is the study of the theoretical foundations of information and computation and of practical techniques for their implementation and application in computer systems. The Web & Database Emphasis focuses on the development of web-based software and the management of data.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

description: Criminal justice is one of the fastest growing areas of study in the United States. It involves the study of the definition, causes and prevention of crime, the legal process and the rehabilitation of offenders.

University of Findlay's White-Collar Crime and Fraud Investigation emphasis will prepare you for a career in the investigation of financial crimes. You will learn to identify, investigate and prevent white-collar crime. This emphasis is a great fit for students who are interested in the intersection of criminal justice and business/accounting. You will take courses in both areas to gain a comprehensive understanding of financial crimes.
Program name: Criminal Justice - White-Collar Crime & Fraud Investigation

description: Data analytics is the science of analyzing raw data to make conclusions about that information. Many of the techniques and processes of data analytics have been automated into mechanical processes and algorithms that work over raw data for human consumption. Data analytics techniques can reveal trends and metrics that would otherwise be lost in the mass of information. This information can then be used to optimize processes to increase the overall efficiency of a business or system.

Sonography, or ultrasound, is a diagnostic medical procedure that uses high frequency sound waves to produce dynamic visual images of organs, tissues, or blood flow inside the body. The University of Findlay offers two tracks within the sonography program: General Sonography (Abdomen, Obstetrics and Gynecology) and Echocardiography (Adult Cardiac Sonography). Students receive academic and clinical preparation for certification exams administered by the American Registry for Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS) and Cardiac Credentialing International (CCI).
Accreditation status: The Diagnostic Medical Sonography Program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) upon the recommendation of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (JRC-DMS).

description: A major in Journalism/Digital Media consists of 48 hours of journalism/digital media core management courses.

Concentration name: Interactive Media, Video Production, and Media Marketing
description: We offer two majors here in the Department of Media & Communication: Digital Media and Journalism. Digital Media has three emphases that you can choose from: Interactive Media, Video Production, and Media Marketing. What do we do here? We produce content! We write, we film, we edit, we talk, and we listen. We have a TV station (UFTV), a radio station (88.3 WLFC), and a newspaper (The Pulse). We also have a student-run public relations firm (The PR Agency).

The Primary (P-5) licensure program prepares teacher candidates to work with children in pre-kindergarten through grade 5. Candidates will learn to create safe, inclusive, and culturally responsive learning environments that support the social, emotional, and academic growth of all students. The program includes field experiences and student teaching to ensure graduates are ready for the classroom.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: Diagnostic medical sonography (DMS) is a multi-specialty profession which utilizes high-frequency sound waves to image the human body. Sonographers use their knowledge of anatomy, physiology and physics to create images which are analyzed by a physician to diagnose medical conditions. The University of Findlay offers a Bachelor of Science degree in Diagnostic Medical Sonography. Students can choose from two areas of concentration: General Sonography (Abdomen, Obstetrics and Gynecology) and Echocardiography (Cardiac Sonography). Echocardiography (Cardiac Sonography) involves evaluation of the anatomy and hemodynamics (blood flow) of the heart, its valves and related blood vessels.
Accreditation status: The Diagnostic Medical Sonography Program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) upon the recommendation of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (JRC-DMS).

description: The economics minor creates an opportunity for students to gain a working knowledge of the analytical tools that are useful in understanding the economic environment of business.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The University of Findlay’s College of Education prepares students to become confident, caring, and competent educators. With a focus on experiential learning, students are in the classroom their first year.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: The Primary (P-5) License prepares candidates to teach prekindergarten through grade 5. Candidates are prepared to teach all content areas (reading, language arts, mathematics, science, and social studies) to students in these grades. From your very first year on campus to your senior student teaching block, you will engage in field experiences in a variety of settings including rural, suburban, and urban schools.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

Concentration name: Creative Writing, General Writing, Literature, Teaching
description: The English major offers four emphases: Creative Writing, General Writing, Literature and Teaching. Students in the English program at the University of Findlay join a close-knit community of writers and scholars. The program provides a flexible curriculum that prepares students for a variety of careers by developing strong communication, critical thinking, and analytical skills.
A major in English leads to the Bachelor of Arts degree. Students may choose one of three emphases: General Writing, Creative Writing, or Literature.

Earn a Bachelor of Arts degree in English with an emphasis in Creative Writing, General Writing or Teaching. The University of Findlay's English program prepares students for a variety of careers by developing their skills in critical thinking, close reading, and effective writing.

Students in the Literature Emphasis immerse themselves in the study of great books. They analyze literature from various time periods and cultures, sharpening their critical thinking and writing skills in the process. This track is ideal for students planning to attend graduate school or pursue careers in law, education, or publishing.

This major prepares students for the Adolescent/Young Adult Integrated Language Arts License (grades 7-12). Students must also complete the requirements for the adolescent/young adult education major to receive the license.

The English equestrian studies program at the University of Findlay has a long-standing reputation as one of the best in the country. Our program has won more Intercollegiate Horse Show Association (IHSA) national championships than any other college or university. We offer an Associate of Arts degree in English equestrian studies and a Bachelor of Science degree in English equestrian studies. You will receive daily riding instruction on high-quality horses as you work toward your degree. You will also learn about: Equine nutrition, Equine reproduction, Barn management, Preventive medicine.

The Entrepreneurship Minor is designed for students who desire to start their own business or work in a small business environment. It is also valuable for those who wish to be intrapreneurs – innovators within large organizations. Students in the minor will learn how to identify and evaluate business opportunities, create and manage new ventures, and think creatively and innovatively.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The University of Findlay’s Environment, Health, Safety, and Sustainability (EH&S) program is prepared to launch you into a successful career in corporate and public sectors. This major focuses on the relationship between environmental sustainability and the health and safety of workers and the community. You will learn how to identify, evaluate, and control environmental and safety hazards, and how to develop and manage programs to prevent injuries and illnesses. Students benefit from hands-on learning through the All-Hazards Training Center and paid internships.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Environment, Health, Safety, and Sustainability is accredited by the Applied and Natural Science Accreditation Commission of ABET

description: Findlay's Environmental, Safety & Occupational Health Management (ESOH) major provides you with the knowledge and skills to make a difference in the world by ensuring the health and safety of workers and the environment. Established in 1986, the Environmental, Safety and Occupational Health Management major is one of the top programs in the nation.
Accreditation status: The Environmental, Safety and Occupational Health Management program is accredited by the Applied and Natural Science Accreditation Commission (ANSAC) of ABET. The Bachelor of Science in Environmental, Safety and Occupational Health Management is also accredited by the National Environmental Health Science and Protection Accreditation Council (EHAC).

description: The equine industry is huge and diverse. It takes more than a love for horses to succeed; it takes business savvy. The University of Findlay’s Equine Business Management major is designed for students with a strong desire to work in the equine industry but not necessarily riding horses. This degree offers a unique combination of top-tier business education and hands-on equestrian experience.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The Associate of Arts in Equine Studies is a two-year degree designed to offer students the opportunity to increase their riding skills and experience, and to learn about the horse industry. Students in the program will select an emphasis in either English or Western riding. The curriculum includes general education courses, as well as riding and equine management classes.

Concentration name: English Equestrian Studies, Western Equestrian Studies
description: Send your riding skills soaring with a degree in equestrian studies from the University of Findlay. We have been helping students build a strong foundation for successful careers in the equine industry for more than 40 years. The University of Findlay’s Equestrian Studies Program invites you to join a winning team. From the barn to the show ring, you will learn the ins and outs of the equine industry. We offer three options in equestrian studies: English Equestrian Studies, Western Equestrian Studies, Associate of Arts in Equestrian Studies.

The University of Findlay's English equestrian program is well known in the industry for the quality of graduates it produces. We offer two degree options: Associate of Arts in English Equestrian Studies and Bachelor of Science in English Equestrian Studies. Both degrees include the same riding and training curriculum. Our program emphasizes the balanced seat method of riding, which is the foundation for jumping, dressage and eventing. You will learn to ride and train horses for the hunter/jumper and eventing disciplines.

The University of Findlay’s western equestrian studies program offers two degree options: Bachelor of Science in Western Equestrian Studies; Associate of Arts in Equestrian Studies - Western Riding/Training Emphasis. Students in the western equestrian studies program ride horses of high quality, learning training techniques from professionals who have been in the business for many years. We are proud that our students have won more than 150 world and reserve world championships. You will be in the barn five days a week, at least three hours a day riding and training horses. In the classroom, you will learn the science and business behind the training.

The University of Findlay’s English equestrian program is designed to prepare students for a career in the equine industry. Students in the program have the opportunity to ride every day, six days a week, on high-quality horses focused on hunter/jumper and dressage training.

The University of Findlay’s Western Equestrian Studies Program has been helping students turn their passion for horses into a career for more than 40 years. We have a simple philosophy: you learn by doing. That’s why our students are in the barn and on a horse starting day one. Students in the Western Equestrian Studies Program have the option of pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Western Equestrian Studies or an Associate of Arts in Equestrian Studies - Western Riding Emphasis.

The Watterson Center for Ethical Leadership at the University of Findlay provides students with the tools and experiences to become ethical leaders in their professions and communities. As a Watterson Scholar, you'll join a select group of students dedicated to making a difference through ethical leadership. Watterson Scholars will earn a minor in Ethical Leadership. The program combines academic coursework with co-curricular activities, including service projects, guest speakers, and networking opportunities.

The Exercise Science for Health Professions major is designed for students who plan to attend graduate school for physical therapy, occupational therapy, athletic training, or physician assistant. This major includes the prerequisites for these graduate programs while providing a strong science background.

Individuals who work in the field of finance help businesses and organizations make sure that they are financially sound. They are responsible for reviewing data and reports, monitoring financial trends, and creating ways to increase profitability.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The Multi-Age License (Pre-K - 12) prepares you to teach students from ages 3 to 21 in a specific subject area. You will take courses in your content area as well as education courses to prepare you for the classroom.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: Forensic science is the application of science to the law. We offer a curriculum that will give you the necessary background and experience to become a forensic scientist. Hands-on coursework, combined with Findlay's vast general education offerings, prepares you for your future career or graduate studies. Students will benefit from: A strong foundation in the natural sciences; Hands-on learning using the same technology found in crime labs; Required field experience/internships.
Accreditation status: The Forensic Science Program is accredited by the Forensic Science Education Programs Accreditation Commission (FEPAC).

description: The Gender Studies minor provides students with an opportunity to examine gender as a social construct and to explore its impact on culture, history, and society. This interdisciplinary program draws upon courses from English, history, psychology, religious studies, sociology, and other disciplines to offer a comprehensive understanding of gender issues.

The Gerontology Minor provides students with the opportunity to study the physical, psychological, and social aspects of aging. The minor is a multidisciplinary program designed to supplement the student’s major area of study. The minor is appropriate for students in any major who have an interest in working with older adults.

Findlay’s Graphic Design program centers on the mastery of visual communication. We blend traditional art methods with the latest digital technology to help you find your creative voice. You will learn to solve problems creatively and communicate ideas effectively. Our program emphasizes design theory, history, and practical application. You will graduate with a professional portfolio that demonstrates your skills and creativity.

Findlay’s Graphic Design program prepares students for a career in the fast-paced world of visual communication. Students learn to combine art and technology to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate consumers.

The Health and Physical Education program prepares you to teach children from pre-kindergarten through grade 12 in both health and physical education. You will be prepared for the Ohio Assessment for Educators (OAE) licensure exams and to apply for the Multi-Age teaching license. This program blends classroom instruction with extensive field work, ensuring you are classroom-ready upon graduation.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: The healthcare management emphasis is designed for students who are interested in the business side of healthcare. This emphasis prepares students for entry-level management positions in hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and other healthcare organizations.

History is more than just names and dates. It is the study of the human experience. As a history major at the University of Findlay, you will develop strong critical thinking, writing and research skills that are highly valued by employers in a wide variety of fields. Students also have the opportunity to work closely with faculty members who are experts in their fields, conduct their own research, and present their findings at conferences.

Human resource managers are the link between management and employees. They help management use the skills of employees to the best of their ability to make the business successful. As a human resource management student at the University of Findlay, you will learn how to: Recruit, interview and hire employees; Consult with top executives on strategic planning; Serve as a link between an organization’s management and its employees.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: Computer Science is the study of the design, analysis, and implementation of software systems. The Computer Science major at the University of Findlay prepares students to be successful in the rapidly changing field of technology. Students will learn to develop software, manage projects, and work effectively in teams. Students choose from one of the following emphasis areas: Business, Computer Systems, Data Analytics, Information Assurance, Information Management and Design, Mathematics, Web and Database.
Accreditation status: The Computer Science program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

description: The Religious Studies major at the University of Findlay is designed to prepare students for many different career paths including ministry, missions, and non-profit work. The program offers a Bachelor of Arts degree with emphases in Biblical Studies, Christian Studies, Comparative Religion, and Intercultural Studies. The Intercultural Studies emphasis is designed for students interested in working in cross-cultural environments, providing the cultural and religious literacy necessary for effective engagement.

International Studies is an interdisciplinary major that offers students a broad understanding of the complex political, economic, social and cultural interrelationships that exist among the nations of the world. Students in this major will acquire knowledge of current international affairs, foreign languages, history, and political science.

The International/Intercultural Studies Minor offers students the opportunity to learn about the world’s diverse cultures and peoples. As globalization continues to impact every aspect of our lives, the ability to understand and communicate with people from different backgrounds is becoming increasingly important. This minor is designed to complement any major and provides students with a competitive edge in the job market.

In this strand, candidates learn to work with students who have specific learning disabilities, mild/moderate cognitive disabilities and emotional disturbances. As an intervention specialist major, you will be prepared to work with children with mild to moderate or moderate to intensive special education needs. You will have the requirements to obtain an Ohio license to teach children from kindergarten through grade 12.
Accreditation status: The University of Findlay College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Intervention Specialist Education/Mild to Moderate Disabilities

description: As a Japanese major at the University of Findlay, you will learn to speak, read and write the language while gaining an understanding of the culture. You will have opportunities to study abroad in Japan to immerse yourself in the language and culture. The program prepares students to be global citizens who can effectively communicate and interact in a Japanese cultural context.

The University of Findlay’s Japanese program offers a Bachelor of Arts degree where you will learn to speak, read, and write in Japanese. In addition to language skills, you will also gain a deep understanding of the Japanese culture, history, and literature. You will be prepared for a variety of careers in business, government, translation, and interpretation.

The Law and the Liberal Arts major is an interdisciplinary program designed to prepare students for the rigors of law school and the legal profession. This major combines courses in history, political science, philosophy, and English to develop the critical thinking, writing, and analytical skills necessary for success in the legal field.

The Liberal Studies major is designed for students who want a broad-based education in the arts, humanities, and social sciences. This major provides a flexible curriculum that allows students to tailor their education to their specific interests and career goals.

The Literature Emphasis provides a traditional course of study for students interested in the analysis and history of literature. This emphasis is excellent preparation for graduate school in English, law school, or for careers in which critical thinking and communication skills are valued.

Every organization needs effective leaders. With a Business Management degree from the University of Findlay, you’ll be prepared to lead in any organization, large or small. Our program provides a broad foundation in business while allowing you to develop the specific management skills needed to succeed in today’s dynamic business environment.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: Marketing is dynamic and ever-changing. It involves the movement of goods and services from the manufacturer to the ultimate consumer. It includes the research, development, pricing and promotion of products. As a marketing major at the University of Findlay, you'll be prepared for a career in professional selling, advertising, market research, retail management and more.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The University of Findlay's Mathematics Program prepares students for the workforce or graduate school. Mathematics is a key component to many professions including business, economics, engineering, physics and computer science. Students in the program will learn to think logically, solve problems and communicate their ideas effectively.

Medical laboratory scientists are health care professionals who perform chemical, hematological, immunological, microscopic, and bacteriological diagnostic analyses on body fluids such as blood, urine, sputum, stool, cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), peritoneal fluid, pericardial fluid, and synovial fluid, as well as other specimens. Medical laboratory scientists work in hospital laboratories, physician's offices, reference laboratories, biotechnology industry, and research laboratories.
Accreditation status: The Medical Laboratory Science Program is accredited by the National Accrediting Agency for Clinical Laboratory Sciences (NAACLS).

Concentration name: Language Arts, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies
description: The Middle Childhood Education program prepares you to teach grades 4-9. You will choose two areas of concentration from the following: Language Arts, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies. Additionally, you will take a variety of education courses to help you manage a classroom and plan your curriculum. As a student in the program, you will also be required to take reading courses (12 semester hours) specifically for the teaching of reading.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: If you are interested in how computers work, how to build and maintain networks, or how to manage and administer databases, then the Computer Systems emphasis is for you. This emphasis prepares students for careers as: Network Administrators, Database Administrators, System Administrators, Web Developers, and Network Engineers.
Accreditation status: The Computer Science program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET.

description: Nuclear medicine technology is a medical specialty that uses radioactive materials to diagnose and treat disease. Nuclear medicine technologists are the medical professionals who prepare and administer these materials to patients and then use specialized equipment to create images of the distribution of the radioactive material in the body.
Accreditation status: The nuclear medicine technology program is accredited by the Joint Review Committee on Educational Programs in Nuclear Medicine Technology (JRCNMT).

description: The University of Findlay’s Nursing Program is designed to prepare students for the role of a professional nurse who can practice in a variety of health care settings. Classes are held in the Health Professions Center and offer a clinical practice lab and simulation center.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree program at the University of Findlay is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education.

description: Operations and logistics management plays a critical role in the economy. It is concerned with the management of the flow of goods and services, involving the movement and storage of raw materials, of work-in-process inventory, and of finished goods from point of origin to point of consumption. Students who focus their studies in operations and logistics will learn to manage the supply chain - from the purchasing of raw materials to the production of goods to the delivery of the final product to the customer.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: Organizational communication is the consideration, analysis, and criticism of the role of communication in organizational contexts. Its function is to inform, persuade and promote goodwill. The major in organizational communication is designed to prepare students for careers in business, industry, government and the non-profit sector. The curriculum focuses on the development of skills in oral and written communication, critical thinking, problem solving and information management. Students will learn to analyze organizational culture, manage conflict, facilitate groups and teams, and design and evaluate communication campaigns.

Philosophy is an inquiry into the fundamental questions of human existence. It explores the nature of reality, knowledge, and value. The study of philosophy develops the ability to think critically, to write clearly, and to solve problems creatively. It provides a strong foundation for law, medicine, theology, public service, and graduate study in the humanities.

Philosophy is the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence. Philosophy trains students to think clearly and critically about the most important questions of life. The University of Findlay’s philosophy program offers a major and minor in philosophy and a minor in applied ethics.

The photography emphasis allows students to explore the creative and technical aspects of photography. Students will learn the mechanics of the camera, darkroom processes, studio lighting and digital imaging. You will also study the history of photography and contemporary trends. This emphasis is designed to prepare you for a career as a professional photographer or for graduate study in photography.

Political science is the study of governments, public policies and political processes, systems, and political behavior. Political science subfields include political theory, political philosophy, political ideology, political economy, policy studies and analysis, comparative politics, international relations, and a host of related fields.

Political science involves the study of government, public policy and the political behavior of individuals and groups. It uses both humanistic and scientific perspectives and skills to examine the U.S. and all countries and regions of the world. Political science majors learn how to think critically, a skill that is essential for a wide variety of professions. Political Science is an excellent major for students interested in attending law school. It is the most popular major for students applying to law school and provides a solid background in the American legal system.

Contra Costa College is one of the few community colleges in the state to offer a Pre-Law Studies program. The Pathways to Law School initiative is a partnership between the California Community Colleges and the State Bar of California. It is designed to give students a clear roadmap to law school and a career in the legal profession.

The University of Findlay’s pre-medicine program is designed to provide you with the competitive edge needed to be accepted into medical school. Because medical schools do not require a specific undergraduate major, you may major in any subject as long as you complete the prerequisite courses required by medical schools. Students typically major in biology, chemistry or animal science. However, you are free to choose a major that interests you. The University of Findlay provides strong preparation for the Medical College Admission Test (MCAT) and offers personalized academic advising from faculty members who are experts in the field.

Psychology is the scientific study of behavior and mental processes. The psychology major at the University of Findlay prepares students for a variety of careers in the helping professions, business, and industry, as well as for graduate study in psychology and related fields. Students will gain a strong foundation in psychological theory and research methods.

The public administration minor is designed to provide students with an understanding of the environment of public service and the role of the public administrator. It is appropriate for students attempting to structure a program of study for careers in the public sector or for those planning to do graduate work in public administration.

Public relations professionals are the voice of an organization. They manage the reputation of a company and help build relationships with the community. As a public relations major at the University of Findlay, you will learn how to create and maintain a positive image for organizations, businesses and individuals. You will develop strong writing and communication skills, and learn how to use social media and other digital platforms to reach your audience.

In this religious studies degree program, you’ll explore the diversity of religions and their cultural and political impact. You’ll learn how religion shapes the world and develop a deep understanding of global traditions. This online religious studies program offers a concentration in religion, culture and public life. It focuses on the role of religion in human culture and the way religion impacts our world. You’ll explore the history, texts and practices of various traditions and apply your knowledge to current issues.

Concentration name: Integrated Science, Life Science, Physical Science
description: The Adolescent/Young Adult (AYA) licensure program prepares teachers to work with students in grades 7 through 12. This program is designed for students who already hold a bachelor’s degree and wish to obtain a teaching license. Students can pursue the license only (post-baccalaureate) or the license plus a Master of Arts in Education (MAE). The program features field experiences and student teaching to ensure candidates are well-prepared for the classroom.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: The University of Findlay’s Second Language Education (TESOL) program prepares students to teach English to speakers of other languages in the United States and abroad. This program leads to a Bachelor of Arts degree and can include an optional Multi-Age (Pre-K – 12) teaching license. The program combines a strong foundation in linguistics and second language acquisition with practical classroom experience.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: The Adolescent/Young Adult Social Studies Program prepares students to be social studies teachers in grades 7-12. Students take a broad range of courses in history, political science, geography, economics, sociology and psychology to prepare them to teach the various social studies courses offered in middle and high schools.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

description: Social work is a profession for those with a strong desire to help improve people's lives. Social workers assist people by helping them cope with issues in their everyday lives, dealing with their relationships, and solving personal and family problems. They help clients work with community resources, such as healthcare, government assistance and schools. They also may work with communities or organizations to create or improve programs and services.
Accreditation status: The Social Work Program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

description: Sociology is the scientific study of human social behavior. As a sociology major, you will study social interaction and organization, social change, social inequality and social institutions. You will analyze the effects of ethnicity, race, sex, age, class and community on individuals and groups. You'll also see how people's lives are affected by social forces and how they can change these forces. Sociology students learn the skills to speak and write clearly, to distinguish between a statistical argument and a moral one, and to work with research data.

Speaking Spanish is a valuable asset in today’s global marketplace. It is the second most common language in the United States and the fourth most spoken language in the world. As a Spanish major at the University of Findlay, you will be prepared for a variety of careers or graduate study. The program focuses on language proficiency and cultural understanding, offering opportunities for study abroad and immersive learning.

The University of Findlay's Spanish program is designed to provide students with the skills needed to be proficient in the language and knowledgeable about the cultures of Spanish-speaking peoples. As a Spanish major at the University of Findlay, you will develop the language skills and cultural awareness necessary to succeed in a variety of careers.

Intervention specialists are licensed educators who work with students who have mild to moderate disabilities in kindergarten through grade 12. University of Findlay's intervention specialist program is designed to help you build the skills and knowledge necessary to work with students with special learning needs. The University of Findlay's College of Education prepares students for licensure as an Intervention Specialist in the mild to moderate (K-12) area. This program leads to a Bachelor of Arts degree. In addition to the intervention specialist licensure, you will also receive the reading endorsement which will make you highly marketable.

Concentration name: Mild to Moderate; Moderate to Intensive
description: The University of Findlay’s intervention specialist program is designed to help you become a teacher for children with special needs. As a student in this program, you will learn the skills to help children with mild to moderate or moderate to intensive disabilities in kindergarten through grade 12. You will be prepared to work in a variety of settings, including: Public schools, Private schools, Residential facilities. Our program provides extensive field experience, starting in your first year. By the time you graduate, you will have more than 1,000 hours of field experience.

The Sport Business Strategy major prepares students for leadership positions in the professional sports industry, intercollegiate athletics, and other sport-related organizations. The curriculum combines a strong business core with specialized courses in sport business. Students gain real-world experience through internships and class projects, preparing them for the unique challenges of the sports industry.
Accreditation status: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)

description: The Strength and Conditioning major at the University of Findlay combines classroom instruction with hands-on experience to prepare students for the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA) Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) exam. Strength and conditioning coaches are responsible for the physical development of athletes. They design and implement training programs to improve athletic performance and reduce the risk of injury. Students in the program will have access to the Oilers Strength and Conditioning Center, a 4,000-square-foot facility equipped with state-of-the-art strength and conditioning equipment.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Council on Accreditation of Strength and Conditioning Education (CASCE).

description: With the rise of the opioid epidemic, there is a growing need for professionals who are trained to help those struggling with addiction. The University of Findlay’s Substance Use Disorder Minor provides students with the educational hours required to apply for the Licensed Chemical Dependency Counselor II (LCDC II) or III (LCDC III) license through the Ohio Chemical Dependency Professionals Board (OCDP). This minor is an excellent addition to majors such as psychology, social work, criminal justice, or nursing, and prepares students for a meaningful career in substance abuse counseling and prevention.

description: Sustainability is the practice of meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. It is based on three pillars: environmental, economic and social equity.

The Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) program at the University of Findlay prepares students to teach English in a variety of settings both in the US and abroad. Findlay's TESOL program is designed to provide you with a strong foundation in language teaching methodology, second language acquisition theory, and English linguistics. You will also gain practical experience through a teaching practicum in our Intensive English Language Program.
Program name: Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL)

description: The Master of Arts in Professional Communication (MAPC) is designed to develop the students’ ability to write, speak, and lead in a variety of professional organizations. The program allows students to tailor their degree to their professional goals.

Concentration name: Performance Emphasis, Production Design and Technology Emphasis, Music Theatre Emphasis
description: Findlay's theatre major is an experiential program. You will receive a generalist theatre education with the opportunity to specialize in performance, music theatre, or production design and technology. Our faculty and staff are dedicated to providing you with the best possible education and training, both in the classroom and on stage. You will have the opportunity to work on four mainstage productions each year, as well as numerous student-directed one-acts and other projects.

The University of Findlay’s Animal Science Program is known for hands-on experience. You will have the opportunity to work with animals on day one. We offer two emphases to help you achieve your career goals: Science (Pre-Veterinary Medicine) and Industry. Acceptance into veterinary school is competitive, but University of Findlay graduates are accepted at a rate nearly twice the national average!

As an English major at the University of Findlay, you will develop strong communication, critical thinking, and research skills that are highly valued by employers in every field. Our program offers a Bachelor of Arts degree with four distinct emphases: Creative Writing, General Writing, Literature, and Teaching. General Writing Emphasis: Focuses on the study and practice of writing in professional, civic, and academic contexts.
